intro: Adinandrella africana, commonly known as the African shea tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its thick, rough bark and large, palmate leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by round, woody fruits containing a fatty seed kernel. The seeds are widely used for their high oil content, which is valuable in cosmetics and food products. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitats and is also culturally significant to local communities.
